intro: Phaseolaster elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic phaseolaster, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive papilionaceous structure typical of the legume family. The elliptic shape of its leaves gives it its common name, and it is often found in humid, shaded environments.
